website_summaries.verdict: Excellent starter zoom lens. Good price for gaining some versatility in your Nikon DSLR camera.
pros: Upgrade over previous Nikon lenses, creating a lighter 18-to-55-millimeter model
Good photo quality for a zoom lens
Vibration reduction technology improves results when shooting while hand-holding camera
cons: May want greater telephoto options if you're going to buy a zoom lens

customer_reviews.title: If you are starting out or just want a carry around lens this is a good buy. It has surprised me on some of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this lens has impressed me but having rented really expensive lens I can see the differences. If you are starting out or just want a carry around lens this is a good buy. It has surprised me on some of the shots I took.
customer_reviews.author: rquiles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners learning SLR photography
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect kit lens for anyone starting out with an SLR. The VR (virbation reduction) feature is especially suited to a young person whose hands are not so steady, or is not yet familiar with the concept of camera shake. The zoom range is quite limited, but is all that can be expected in such a light-weight lens.
customer_reviews.author: pavan

customer_reviews.title: Lens may be good, if purchased from an honest seller
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure for a basic lens this one typically preforms very well. Unfortunately, I purchased one that was supposed to be in like new condition, which was not accurate. The one I received was completely banged up, to the point I would maybe, maybe consider it in an acceptable condition. It has a terrible time focusing, so you can forget getting the shot you want. Pretty sure the internals are guncked up or wore out. Really unfortunate and a waste of money. Make sure you know what you're getting, and buy from a reputable seller.
customer_reviews.author: Petitewboobs

customer_reviews.title: Great basic lens
customer_reviews.text: Great basic lens. It doesn't have huge zoom capacity, but that's because it is relatively compact. For some reason, the camera body often tells me that the lens is not attached, even when it is attached and operational. I don't know whether that is the fault of the lens or the camera body. I have learnt just to ignore the error message. My only real complaint is that it does not have the right focal length for great macros.
customer_reviews.author: a reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little lens. Took it out to shoot our annual Texas Bluebonnet Trip and it took some really sharp pictures. My D7100 came with a 18-140mm lens which is wonderful, but gets really heavy after an hour or two. This little guy is light weight, and I drug it around for several hours. Between this lens and my Tokina Ultra Wide, I think I got some really great shots. Seller was accurate in his description and quick on delivery. The lens was packaged REALLY well. Would buy from this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Luvmydog

customer_reviews.title: A good lens and great for a specialty use
customer_reviews.text: I have more than a few Nikon lenses and would not normally have gone with this particular one except that recently had a Nikon D7000 converted for IR use [only] the the conversion company said that this was a good lens for that purpose. At this moment, I have to agree and it will be the permanent lens on the converted body.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Benson

customer_reviews.title: As good as the lens directly from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this to replace a very similar lens that he had gotten directly from Nikon almost 10 years ago. The lens was out of stock with Nikon, and was significantly cheaper from this retailer, so we purchased with some trepidation. Happy to report that quality has no issues, husband is very happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: WhenInRome

customer_reviews.title: I recently got a Nikon D3200 with a 55-200mm lense ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a Nikon D3200 with a 55-200mm lense (non VR *FeelsBadMan*) , and I wanted the 'standard kit' lense. I was going to get the 1st gen VR 18-55, but the smaller profile of the VRII put it over the top. Now if Nikon made a VR II of the 55-200 .. *Kappa*
customer_reviews.author: Josh Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens when the refurbished one on purchased (same model) didn't work out of the box. So far this one is great....of course it is a new one, not used! The AF is pretty quick for a basic kit lens and the clarity and range are good as well. It is a good everyday lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap rear lens cap!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it! Lens looks Ok. Does'nt look new by any means.Works OK for now.Took a few snaps indoor.The rear lens cap is very cheap and white plastic cap.Not anywhere close to the original Nikkor lens cap.The original is not expensive at all! Will update about the lens later.Now I need to order the rear lens cap possibly from Nikon website! They claimed that this lens is new and got it out of a Camera bundle and not used at all! Had GDS Technology lens cover!
customer_reviews.author: NiCamman

customer_reviews.title: Lens works very well for what it is
customer_reviews.text: When traveling I like the versatility of Nikon’s 18-300mm zoom. But for everyday shooting I’d like a lighter, compact medium range zoom. Most medium zooms are still expensive and not much smaller or lighter than my travel zoom. The Nikon 18-55mm, although not a preferred range for me, is very well priced, performs quickly and flawlessly, is definitely small and light, and covers most of my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bortzjr

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is a upgraded lens for the original Nikon, is quite a bit lighter, and has a barrel lock button that my other lens didn't have. I just hope the lightness of the lens isn't because the optics aren't as well made. The only way to know about that is with continued use. I'll let you know if things go sour. But honestly I think this is well made and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Santee, Ca.

customer_reviews.title: Its a solid lens with very nice build quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens for a friend that bought my D5100 body from me. It is usually kit lens. Its a solid lens with very nice build quality. Not sure how I feel about the lock on the barrel. Not sure I have ever really needed a lock on there. Its pretty much the only lens Nikon makes that has the lock. But I used it for a few days before giving it to him, and I was very impressed. And he seems to love the lens!
customer_reviews.author: Giantsfan510

customer_reviews.title: Great walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: Great walk around lens. Ordered this to take on a trip to Finland and it spent most of the time on my camera during the trip. VR allowed me to shoot indoors with low light. Overall I am very happy with the lens. I am finding that I prefer Nikon lenses even the inexpensive ones to third party lenses. Mine was a refurbished model and has performed flawlessly for a very cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Toivo

customer_reviews.title: Great Nikkor 18-55 lens at a 'used' price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens to replace similar 18-55 Nikkor that I broke at an area car show. It's a little smaller than my older original lens, but just as good. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Racer Z

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: The lens works but is "Grey Market" without Nikon USA warrantee. False advertising as by Nikon. 3rd party not an authorized Nikon dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not product I thought I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I had another 18-55 previously that I loved - but this one seems like an older version and photo quality isn't as good and has a button to push to rotate zoom.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The fit finder said this lens would work with my camera. I got it in and once I had time to try it out, my screen says the lens isn't installed. So obviously it doesn't work with my camera. I emailed him for a return and he denied it, asked me no questions, didn't try to help me at all. So now I have a USELESS lens that I spent $220 on. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens
customer_reviews.text: Its been nearly a year since I purchased this and this works great! I previously had these lens for my camera and it broke due to a fall so I was looking for a replacement lens. I wanted the exact same lens and wasn't looking for something brand new but rather in very good condition and looked new. This lens was just that and it came as it was described. Very new and a little bit dust but it doesn't effect the photos at all. Very happy with my purchase! :)
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement lens to original lens that came with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement lens to original lens that came with my Nikon D40X camera. Original lens was having issue mounting, and slow to respond to shutter. This new lens is working perfectly with the added features of being able to lock the lens closed and VR capability. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phenix401

customer_reviews.title: Improved vibration reduction but quetionable lens retract lock button.
customer_reviews.text: Had to purchase to replace a broken lens mount after a fall while on a tripod. Love the improvement of the vibration reduction. Not really sure about the button to lock the lens in the retracted position. Can just picture myself in a rush to change lens and not being able to activate because it is in the retracted position.
customer_reviews.author: Technonut

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have time to try it out when I first got it. Sat untouched and the first time I went to use it, it doesn’t work!! It’s too late to return it, so I’m out the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know the difference between AF-P and AF-S and which one your camera uses.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Someone gave me a hand-me-down D3200 and the AF-S hook right up and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Plp

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding all around lens. Went to monument valley and rarely changed lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Millar

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement lens.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a broken lens of the same kind (AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G). So far all the photo look great, just like a brand new lens.
customer_reviews.author: Harley L. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lenses for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got it to replace my kit lenses that my wife accidentally dropped. Very nice lenses.
customer_reviews.author: longskilong

customer_reviews.title: Auto focus and image stabilization works well
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a similar lens and this one fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as my 18-200 lens which died but great for what its capabilities are.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Lens
customer_reviews.text: Great starter lens to get various focal lengths. I upgraded to this after my original lens broke and the VR on this one is so much better than my older model.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Just received this as a replacement for a nikon lens that had a miss fortunate tumble. This is better than the one I'm replacing. So happy that I can take pictures again. Did some quick shots and the pictures look great.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Glass w/ VR
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I upgraded from the 18-55mm GII ED to have the VR capability. I can go as low as 1/10 without experiencing noticeable blur :)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan M.

customer_reviews.title: Super compact! Love this item!
customer_reviews.text: This is my absolute favorite lens I have ever owned! So versatile and unlike the older version of this exact lens this one is way more compact! It locks into place when you are not using it so you don't have to worry about it getting twisted to far and breaking!
customer_reviews.author: T. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Bought a used one for a third of the price!
customer_reviews.text: The product might have been used but you could tell! The pictures are great and the product is used almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: 18-55 works perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine used from Cardinal Camera and Video. It came very well packaged and in perfect condition. I have a NikonD40 so wanted a lens with the motor built in (my other lens does not). The lens works perfectly for what I use it for - mainly shooting old barns out the car window. I am very happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: JANA

customer_reviews.title: Great deal Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: So what if this lens uses plastic gears instead of the higher-priced lens that uses metal gears? With a five-year guarantee and 1/5 the price I figure I just can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Clam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the exact lens that I dropped. Great delivery; timely and in perfect condition. Works great !
customer_reviews.author: G1TPA

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great overall lens and well worth the price. It's reliable, durable and takes great photos. It's nothing fancy, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap. Is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The zoom wheel is not smooth at all. I wouldn't recommend this if you will be using it for primarily recording purposes.
customer_reviews.author: KeltronX

customer_reviews.title: Makes too much noise when autofocusing
customer_reviews.text: Eh, I wouldn't buy again without trying it out first. The autofocus on it sounds terrible in video playback. You can hear the creeking noises as it focuses. Not sure if it's because it's used or that it's just how it is...
customer_reviews.author: Zecharia G.

customer_reviews.title: Good clear pictures
customer_reviews.text: The auto focus is fast and the pictures are clear
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great overall lens. I purchased used and it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: AaronSr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seller, I am happy with the product, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: German Molina

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work with my camera despite the description saying it was compatible.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer vega

customer_reviews.title: I got a great used but new lens
customer_reviews.text: I got a great used but new lens. Love it and it stays on my camera most of the time. I have a 85mm and 35mm for special purposes but this is the workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Duldulao

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: really good buy I needed this lens , didn't have one
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gundersen

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value And Coverage
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lens that would complement my 70-300mm Nikon zoom lenses. So far, it has proven to be a very cost effective purchase. I am very pleased with the results, using it extensively on a vacation trip to Blowing Rock, NC.
customer_reviews.author: gzim

customer_reviews.title: I have several of these and they are excellent lenses. The defective one just zooms in and ...
customer_reviews.text: I got a defective one (brand new from Nikon through Amazon) and have to send it back. I have several of these and they are excellent lenses. The defective one just zooms in and out rapidly and repeatedly and gives completely blurry photos. Tried it on several cameras just to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-35 zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: The old cons about lenses could apply here : "Has a plastic rear mount", "a kit lens", "small in size compared to other competing lenses" - the list could go on I'm sure. With another lens, any of these issues could be a real problem, or sink it. With this little Nikon though, they're really just not a problem. The only "problem" you'll have, is carrying around a more expensive, bulkier lens that doesn't get any better an image that this one provides. The Nikon AF-S dx 18-55mm f3.5-5.6G VR II lens is a good buy, is very hardy, and produces very good quality images. It earns the right to belong in everyones camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Doug English

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens, quick, sharp, always focusing. That's a Nikon optic : what else do you want to say ?
customer_reviews.author: Beaumarchais

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this lens. The picture quality is great. I love that the lens locks closed.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores E

customer_reviews.title: I like the lock position
customer_reviews.text: Much cooler lens than what came with the camera. I like the lock position.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Kit lens shines
customer_reviews.text: This is a kit lens, but it's one of the sharpest lenses out there, kit or otherwise. And it's truly remarkable when the low price is factored in.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and small!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice sharp lens to compliment my D5200. Pictures look sharper than my older 18-105. Love the size because with the D5200 it makes for a very compact grab and go camera.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus P. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Nikon for years. And now that I have a brand new lens, I will be a Nikon user forever. Awesome products.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Remington

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good lens. Works perfectly, exactly as described. Compliments to honest seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for ours that broke. It was worth the money....
customer_reviews.author: Niterythm

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this deal
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT!! Exactly what I needed as a replacement lens!!! Back to taking my 100 pics a day 😁
customer_reviews.author: lucy garcia

customer_reviews.title: Camera lens
customer_reviews.text: This was spot on for my camera. It was a good purchase and a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer: R.L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very clear and easy to use. much better than the replacement of the older version!
customer_reviews.author: Kiktor

customer_reviews.title: Good economy lens
customer_reviews.text: Good lens. As commented by others very short turn for manual focusing and manual focus ring moves when zooming.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a replacement for original lens that came with our Nikon.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a replacement for original lens that came with our Nikon. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Monique Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Very poor image quality.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad copy but this lens was just awful on a Nikon D7200. The outer quarter of the frame is very blurry with massive chromatic aberration. Also this lens feels incredibly cheap as it is all plastic down to the mount with and odd cheap feel to the zoom and unlock mechanism. I thought this would make a good compact travel lens based on very positive image quality reviews on photo sites, but the image quality is in no way acceptable by today's standards on a 24 megapixel camera. I was so disappointed I returned the lens and decided not to try another copy. I would recommend the Nikon 18-140 or a used Nikon 18-105 instead.
customer_reviews.author: DeftDriver

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase, good price, shipped right away, delivered before promise date and a lens works great.
customer_reviews.author: chuck wilmink

customer_reviews.title: Grade A Lens
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my camera. Stellar deal too for the quality
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for the kit lens that comes with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for the kit lens that comes with the camera, much higher quality and I like the lock feature
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Good all purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I thought it was broken at first, but realized it was in lock mode. Definitely a good all purpose lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jkim676

customer_reviews.title: Best bargain for a "walking-around" DX lens
customer_reviews.text: Lens arrived days before scheduled, which is great. This is an under-appreciated "kit lens", but performs very well, even in low light and handheld, with the VRII capability. Maybe a perfect zoom range for a walking-around lens, and gives you much more flexibility over just using the (really excellent) 35mm prime G lens. Focuses quickly. I like the lock for transport, but it will keep you from using any type of rubber band or other grip on the focus ring, if you like to focus manually, like I do. Overall, quite a bargain lens.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great lens
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as a lot of lenses, but it is incredibly versatile for a cheap lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra Barebo

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The lens performed as expected after the original was dropped and broke. Delivered on time and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Koontz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 2nd lens when I don't need to carry my 18-200. Very sharp and great marco.
customer_reviews.author: CHEERSJC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work very upset
customer_reviews.text: I got it and it didn’t work. It won’t focus at all
customer_reviews.author: Barrett McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love having a lens that can lock, it helps to keep it safe.
customer_reviews.author: DippyDiscoBall

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully! Unbelievable price
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully! Unbelievable price! Was actually "new", I don't think it was ever even taken out of the factory box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoy this lens on my hikes. It is a great starter lens for Landscapes!
customer_reviews.author: james Clemens

customer_reviews.title: I use this lens all the time
customer_reviews.text: A classic low cost Nikon lens. It is very light and small. I owned the earlier version on my previous camera and this version is actually lighter and smaller than the previous version. Also, this version has the grooves for attaching a hood (came with one), the previous version did not have one. The only complaint I have is that this lens does not take good pictures when the conditions are not perfect - example - cloudy day or less light.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit my camera and I was told it would.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Ojile

customer_reviews.title: Horrid price, great lens
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lens on and off for about 4 months now I believe. It's an amazing lens, takes bold pictures and does a great job at reducing noise. One reason I can't reccomend this lens is it's not a 250$ noticeable difference. You're better off getting yourself a 18-140 VR for the same price. I personally regret spending the money on this lens however it does have its uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised and as good as new. Quick delivery, too.
customer_reviews.author: jerry w

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nikon D3300 body so I wanted to get the new version of the Nikon 18-55 mm lens. I have a D3100 that came with an older version of the lens. Love the smallness of the lens, the VR feature which the other did not have. Photos have been great. Really don't know if the quality is that much better than my previous lens, but it makes me think it is.
customer_reviews.author: Photoguy41

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Not troubles so far. Excited to be taking shots again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic lens
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she loves it. It seemed a little lightweight to me. A lens should have some weight I think since it should be full of glass, but it works nice and smooth, its quiet and she gets great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used 18-55MM lens because it was about 1/3 the price of a new one. The AF lends is smooth enough for my needs and it works as expected. I was a little disappointed that it did not come with the owners manual or Nikon booklets. All I got was bubble wrap and a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens for the price. Small, light and as sharp as a kit lens is expected to be.
customer_reviews.author: Mirza

customer_reviews.title: Its  perfect  for what  it's  for
customer_reviews.text: i bought this so i wouldn't have to carry my bulkier lenses everywhere i go. It takes great pics and a great camera for the price. no complaints here
customer_reviews.author: oplismiles

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens and wonderful package of items to accompany it.
customer_reviews.author: steebncurtis

customer_reviews.title: Light and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to replace my old non-VR 18-55mm. I love it so far. This has now become my favorite lens that I use with my D7000. It is light, fast focusing and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Msl5575

customer_reviews.title: Got it refurb and it came brand new. Happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I had originally bought a nikon camera for my boyfriend for christmas and the next day he broke the lens that came with this.. so i ordered this one for him and its 100 times better than the one he had i love the VR setting on this
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Since the price is not bad on this one I traded up from the older, larger predecessor. The only thing I don't like about it is the button that has to be pressed to activate the lens. I keep forgetting that I have to do that and wondering why the shudder won't fire. I guess after I get used to it the lens staying put will be an advantage. Image quality is good, not noticeably better that the older 18-55.
customer_reviews.author: Delphine Darcel

customer_reviews.title: Great lens,  so much smaller than the previous model
customer_reviews.text: Wow, bought this used, looked brand new. So much smaller than the previous model. My wife was very very happy. I was so pleased with the quality and I saved about 50% by buying used.
customer_reviews.author: Etechhy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, lightweight, and has adequate zoom for most situations. Great lens for the money. If it were a bit faster it would be close to perfect.
customer_reviews.author: R. Toma

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Worth what I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Worth what I paid for it. My Nikon digital camera was not working. Took it in and they said it would be about what I paid for the new one so I went with this and am happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma's Love

customer_reviews.title: This is a great lens when you are doing everyday shooting and you ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens when you are doing everyday shooting and you don't need telephoto to get a shot. Small compact and light.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL S MOSELEY

customer_reviews.title: new lens from an original package deal
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a beauty - crystal clear quality - small form factor and amazing zoom out for use in closed spaces (like homes) photograhy. My 50 mm goes into a sale shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, compact lens which I keep on my D90 for everyday use. It's light, sharp, and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: CobaltNine

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating this review!!! Auto focus does not work. I'm updating this review!!!!! Operator error! I had been playing with back button focus and I forgot I had switched when I put this lens on the camera. My apologies! Great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Downes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, it works great and the pictures look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Basic kit lens done well
customer_reviews.text: Light and compact. The focal range is appropriate to the Nikon 1 series 1" sensor. Auto focus is really fast to the extent you hardly notice it. It's hard to say much about the image quality as the V1 I own is the limiting factor. It will be interesting to see DxOMark results when this is lens is paired up with the V3.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: The best value ever for a low price kit lens
customer_reviews.text: The best value ever for a low price kit lens,sharp is great even at widest and max. aperture !!!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe S. Valles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, works great, fast delivery, very happy with my order.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Reedy

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! IT IS A REFURBISHED!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit lens and I use it quite often. I had to give it only 4 stars because for the price you would think your getting a NEW lens, but in fact it is actually refurbished. Very miss leading by Cameta Camera. The price of this product seems to change every few days. I've seen it go from $98 to $247... for somewhere in the middle you can buy a brand new lens from a Nikon dealer and enjoy the full 5 year warranty instead of a 90 day limited warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.Top Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G Vibration Reduction II Zoom Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G Vibration Reduction II Zoom Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


AN ULTRA-COMPACT, ALL-AROUND LENS THAT DRAWS PEAK PERFORMANCE FROM DX-FORMAT HD-SLRS.
Life is full of interesting views, and you need a lens that can catch them all. Whether you're shooting wide group photos or portraits, close-ups or landscapes, photos or HD videos, the AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II delivers the sharpest, most color-rich results imaginable. Optimized for Nikon's new high-resolution DX-format image sensors, it borrows the ultra-compact retractable lens barrel design from the Nikon 1 system. Nikon's remarkable Vibration Reduction technology provides 4.0 stops* of blur-free handheld shooting—enjoy crisp, clear images even if your hands are a bit unsteady and shoot at slower shutter speeds in low-light situations. No matter where you're headed, grab the AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II and rest assured: you'll be able to land fantastic shots.



GREAT FOR NEARLY ANY SITUATION
VERSATILE 18–55MM FOCAL LENGTH RANGE
There's a reason Nikon includes an 18-55mm lens with so many D-SLR kits—it's simply a fantastic all-around lens. The AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II is the most compact, advanced version of the 18-55mm lens yet. A new retractable barrel design inspired by the Nikon 1 system makes it approx. 25% smaller and lighter than its predecessors, and the latest Vibration Reduction technology provides 4.0* stops of blur-free handheld shooting. Whether you're shooting wide group shots or tight close-ups, photos or HD videos, the AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II delivers.

UNLEASH THE POWER OF YOUR HD-SLR
OPTIMIZED FOR DX-FORMAT CAMERAS
The AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II is optimized to draw maximum performance from Nikon's new generation of high-resolution DX-format HD-SLRs. Nikon's Super Integrated Coating (SIC) ensures outstanding color richness and contrast by reducing reflections and glare. A seven-blade rounded diaphragm renders backgrounds and out-of-focus elements in your shots with a natural, softly blurred appearance. Your photos and HD videos will reveal the astounding sharpness and detail your HD-SLR is capable of achieving.

SHARPER PHOTOS AND HD VIDEOS
THE NIKON VIBRATION REDUCTION ADVANTAGE
The AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II features Nikon's latest Vibration Reduction image stabilization technology, which provides 4.0* stops of blur-free handheld shooting. That means your photos and videos will be tack-sharp, even if your hands are a bit unsteady. Additionally, it means you'll be able to shoot at slower shutter speeds without affecting image sharpness—a huge advantage in low light situations where slower shutter speeds mean brighter photos.

*Based on CIPA Standard. This value is achieved when DX-format compatible lenses are attached to a DX-format digital SLR camera and zoom lenses are set at the maximum telephoto position.



SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 * LC-52 Snap-on Front Lens Cap 52mm
 * LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
